The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: forced history\, forced compassion\, it felt like they had a good story but changed it mid production. They try so hard to make you feel bad about the main antagonist that they forgot about the game.Gameplay is amazing and all. But I wouldn't believe the same team did write the story of this game.It's not a bad game\, but no one waited the last of us for the gameplay but the story.They dedicated more time on the rope physics (which are amazing) than the develop of the second and last part of the story.And the ending it just shouted out loud \"We are making a 3rd game\".I'm not mad about the ending\, I'm mad about how it happened.In summary\, this was like a school project. People made their part of the story and they tried to fix it together.graphics 10/10gameplay 10/10story 2/10Giving 0 to the director\, he didn't guide the team in such a way they could work this out.Trailer completly diferent from the actual game.
